jodd.mail

Class ReceiveMailSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • jodd.mail.ReceiveMailSession

  • public class ReceiveMailSession
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulates email receiving session. Prepares and receives message(s). Some methods do not work on POP3 servers.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static java.lang.String DEFAULT_FOLDER 
      protected javax.mail.Folder folder 
      protected javax.mail.Session session 
      protected javax.mail.Store store 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ReceiveMailSession(javax.mail.Session session, javax.mail.Store store)
      Creates new mail session.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      void close()
      Closes session.
      protected void closeFolderIfOpened()
      Closes folder if opened and expunge deleted messages.
      java.lang.String[] getAllFolders()
      Returns list of all folders.

      Returns the number of deleted messages.

      Returns number of messages.

      Returns the number of new messages.

      Returns the number of unread messages.

      Opens session.

      Receives all emails.

      Receives all emails that matches given filter.
      ReceivedEmail[] receiveEmailAndDelete()
      Receives all emails and mark all messages as 'seen' and 'deleted'.
      ReceivedEmail[] receiveEmailAndDelete(EmailFilter emailFilter)
      Receives all emails that matches given filter and mark all messages as 'seen' and 'deleted'.
      ReceivedEmail[] receiveEmailAndMarkSeen()
      Receives all emails and mark all messages as 'seen' (ie 'read').
      ReceivedEmail[] receiveEmailAndMarkSeen(EmailFilter emailFilter)
      Receives all emails that matches given filter and mark them as 'seen' (ie 'read').

      Opens default folder: INBOX.

        public ReceiveMailSession(javax.mail.Session session,
                          javax.mail.Store store)

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open()
        Opens session.

      • getAllFolders

        public java.lang.String[] getAllFolders()
        Returns list of all folders. You can use these names in useFolder(String) method.

      • useFolder

        public void useFolder(java.lang.String folderName)
        Opens new folder and closes previously opened folder.

      • useDefaultFolder

        public void useDefaultFolder()
        Opens default folder: INBOX.

      • getMessageCount

        public int getMessageCount()
        Returns number of messages.

      • getNewMessageCount

        public int getNewMessageCount()
        Returns the number of new messages.

      • getUnreadMessageCount

        public int getUnreadMessageCount()
        Returns the number of unread messages.

      • getDeletedMessageCount

        public int getDeletedMessageCount()
        Returns the number of deleted messages.

      • receiveEmail

        public ReceivedEmail[] receiveEmail()
        Receives all emails. Messages are not modified. However, servers may set SEEN flag anyway, so we force messages to remain unseen.

      • receiveEmail

        public ReceivedEmail[] receiveEmail(EmailFilter emailFilter)
        Receives all emails that matches given filter. Messages are not modified. However, servers may set SEEN flag anyway, so we force messages to remain unseen.

      • receiveEmailAndMarkSeen

        public ReceivedEmail[] receiveEmailAndMarkSeen()
        Receives all emails and mark all messages as 'seen' (ie 'read').

      • receiveEmailAndMarkSeen

        public ReceivedEmail[] receiveEmailAndMarkSeen(EmailFilter emailFilter)
        Receives all emails that matches given filter and mark them as 'seen' (ie 'read').

      • receiveEmailAndDelete

        public ReceivedEmail[] receiveEmailAndDelete()
        Receives all emails and mark all messages as 'seen' and 'deleted'.

      • receiveEmailAndDelete

        public ReceivedEmail[] receiveEmailAndDelete(EmailFilter emailFilter)
        Receives all emails that matches given filter and mark all messages as 'seen' and 'deleted'.

      • receive

        public ReceivedEmail[] receive(EmailFilter filter,
                               javax.mail.Flags flagsToSet)
        Receives all emails that matches given filter and set given flags. Both filter and flags to set are optional. If flags to set is not provided, it forces 'seen' flag to be unset.

      • closeFolderIfOpened

        protected void closeFolderIfOpened()
        Closes folder if opened and expunge deleted messages.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes session.
